fields.title: Setup your device for coding
fields.instructions:
Depending on whether you're using a computer or a smartphone, complete *any ONE* of the following tasks. **You don't need to do both!** **If you are using your computer:-** You can use Notepad, Notepad++, Visual Studio Code or any other text editor for this course. Open the text editor and Take a screenshot after typing "<html></html>" in it. **If you are using your phone:-** Watch this video and follow the instructions in the video to set up your smartphone for coding:- English - https://youtu.be/LpxpPaQgSXE?t=18 Tamil - https://youtu.be/b2OkBFwcfxo?t=22 **

Note - The video asks you to get "Code Editor" app, but please note that you have to actually get "Acode" app on play store instead. This is the better app.

** Once you are done, attach the following screenshots:- 1) Show that both the "Coding Keyboard" app and "Acode" app are installed on your phone 2) You should add the code "<html></html>" in the Acode app
fields.searchField:
setup your device for codingdepending on whether you're using a computer or a smartphone, complete *any one* of the following tasks. **you don't need to do both!** **if you are using your computer:-** you can use notepad, notepad++, visual studio code or any other text editor for this course. open the text editor and take a screenshot after typing "<html></html>" in it. **if you are using your phone:-** watch this video and follow the instructions in the video to set up your smartphone for coding:- english - https://youtu.be/lpxppaqgsxe?t=18 tamil - https://youtu.be/b2okbfwcfxo?t=22 **

note - the video asks you to get "code editor" app, but please note that you have to actually get "acode" app on play store instead. this is the better app.

** once you are done, attach the following screenshots:- 1) show that both the "coding keyboard" app and "acode" app are installed on your phone 2) you should add the code "<html></html>" in the acode app

fields.title: First HTML File
fields.instructions:
Do the following:-
1) Enter the HTML code shown in the first image titled "Code Sample" into the Acode app or your desktop text editor and then save it as "Sample.html".
2) After saving the file, take a screenshot of the code.
3) Preview the HTML code by opening it in the browser and take a screenshot of the preview.

Make sure to enter your name, class and school name ( eg. SGP, DHA, ERD etc) there in the code.

Attach both the screenshots and then mark this as done.

If you're on a computer, use Google to learn how to take screenshot of your computer screen without taking photos of it.

![Code sample](https://res.cloudinary.com/svidhya/image/upload/v1632656170/Code_Sample_werdrc.png)

![Code preview](https://res.cloudinary.com/svidhya/image/upload/v1632656170/Code_Preview_pay8ub.png)

3) preview the html code by opening it in the browser and take a screenshot of the preview.

fields.title: Complete 21% of HTML challenges
fields.instructions: Complete at least 21% of HTML challenges on FreeCodeCamp and attach screenshot of proof.

fields.title: Common HTML Tags
fields.instructions:
Watch the video:-

English - https://youtu.be/t5iOpoDdIYI

Tamil - https://youtu.be/9UF0E39iS-g

Tasks:-

I) . Create a new HTML file and save it as "Common-tags.html"

II) . The file should contain the basic structure of the HTML file (i.e. with html tag, head tag, title tag, body tag etc. )

III). Inside the body tag, create the following tags with some text inside:-

1) h1

2) h2

3) h3

4) h4

5) h5

6) h6

7) p

8) div

9) i

10) b

11) u

12 ul

13) ol

14) hr

15) span

IV) Attach screenshot of both the HTML code and the preview on your phone.


Use this site as reference if you need to see how a tag is used - https://www.w3schools.com/tags/default.asp

fields.title: Tables & Images
fields.instructions:
Please watch the video to learn how to write code for Tables and Images in HTML:-

English - https://youtu.be/6vU6IYw06Co

Tamil - https://youtu.be/t4O5EHvAN_A

Your tasks:-

1) Create a new HTML file with the necessary tags (i.e. html, head, title and body tags)
2) Inside the body tag create a HTML table with at least 3 columns and 3 rows. Use the code shown in the video for reference. Or use w3schools for reference.
3) Add an image tag to the page below the table tag. In the src attribute of the image tag, use this value - "https://i.imgur.com/uMsbsbd.png"
4) Take screenshots of both the code and the output and attach in the exercise below.
fields.searchField:
tables & imagesplease watch the video to learn how to write code for tables and images in html:-

english - https://youtu.be/6vu6iyw06co

tamil - https://youtu.be/t4o5ehvan_a

your tasks:-

1) create a new html file with the necessary tags (i.e. html, head, title and body tags)
2) inside the body tag create a html table with at least 3 columns and 3 rows. use the code shown in the video for reference. or use w3schools for reference.
3) add an image tag to the page below the table tag. in the src attribute of the image tag, use this value - "https://i.imgur.com/umsbsbd.png"
4) take screenshots of both the code and the output and attach in the exercise below.

fields.title: JS Data Types
fields.instructions:
Watch this video to learn about the Data Types in JS

English - https://youtu.be/vfh8A3CJRrk

Tamil - https://youtu.be/VBbVf8rFY1s

Once you've finished watching the video, go to Codepn.io and create a new pen and in the JS window, write JS statements to do the following:-

1. Create a variable to store a number
2. Create a variable to store a string
3. create a variable to store an array
4. create a variable to store an object with at least 3 key value pairs
5. create a function to display all of these variables in separate lines and then call that function at the end.


Watch the video more than once if necessary. Once you complete these 5 tasks listed above, save the pen and paste the link down below and click on submit.

fields.title: HTML Project 1 - Part 2
fields.instructions:
Watch this video to understand what to do:-

English - https://youtu.be/-W5fssri9fk

Tamil - https://youtu.be/f9RKZ_5p_A0

1. Watch the video above carefully
2. Go to the same codepen you used in the HTML Project 1 and add the HTML code necessary to achieve what is described in the video.
3. If you want to use a photo in your phone in the img tag, you should first upload it to the internet and then get a web URL for the image to use in the src attribute of the image tag. You can use this service to upload images - https://imgbb.com. And after uploading the image, click on the Embed Code dropdown and select "HTML full-linked" and then from the box below that copy the link shown in the src attribute. Make sure that the URL you've copied ends with .jpg, that's how you can know that it is an image URL.

After adding your code to the pen, save your changes and add the link to your codepen as a private comment and then mark it as done.

after adding your code to the pen, save your changes and add the link to your codepen as a private comment and then mark it as done.

fields.title: CSS Common Properties
fields.instructions:
Please watch this video:-

English - https://youtu.be/kE5hlpXD250

Tamil - https://youtu.be/xrlQ4GQ84mg

Your tasks in this assignment:-
1. Create a new Codepen and create a new HTML document with all the basic tags (html, head, title body etc.)
2. Add the following tags with some text inside - h1, h2, p, span, div, h4, h5, and a few other tags if necessary.
3. Use the following CSS properties in your codepen correctly, as shown in the video.

1) color
2) background-color
3) font-weight
4) font-size
5) text-decoration
6) margin
7) padding
8) width
9) height
10) max-height
11) max-width
12) border

Once you add all the necessary code in the codepen and preview your code, save it and submit the link to the codepen as a private comment.

Once you are on that page, click on "Go to the first lesson" button.

fields.title: Final Project
fields.instructions:
You have to create a website as your final project. You can pick one of the following topics or choose your own kind of website to build:-

1. Website for a school
2. Website for a photographer
3. Website for a shop keeper
4. Website to show tourist places in your region
5. Website for your team
6. ***Your own Idea!***

Your project website will be evaluated on the following criteria. 

- **Overall presentation** - How visually appealing and well-organised your website looks, proper usage of colors, proper spacing etc.
- **Complexity of features** - No. of pages in your website, how much content, how many varieties of features
- **Creativity** - How realistic your website looks, use of media (images/videos/audio clips/animations)
- **Learning to learn** - Bonus features that you learned on your own (use of features not taught in the course)
- **Originality** - How unique is your project?
- **Code quality** - Formatting of code, no repetitive code, fewer lines of code, proper comments

- **code quality** - formatting of code, no repetitive code, fewer lines of code, proper comments
